title: Kylie Jenner Credits Travis Scott For Reminding Her That Women Can Be ‘Sexy’ And ‘Badass’ Mothers
text:
From ELLE

Kylie Jenner has praised her Travis Scott for helping her embrace motherhood and her sexuality, revealing that despite becoming parents almost two years ago, the pair still have ‘good chemistry’.

Earlier this week, the 22-year-old teased her new ‘Wild in Love’ cover interview and photoshoot with Playboy. The star collaborated with her rapper boyfriend for the project for which he provided creative direction.

In her cover story for the publication, the beauty mogul thanked the musician for helping her navigate being a mother and a young woman.

‘You remind me that motherhood and sexuality can co-exist and just because you embrace your sexuality doesn't mean you have loose morals or you're not a good mother,’ Jenner told the rapper. ‘You can be sexy and still be a badass mum.’

The rapper added that while he has heard that parenthood can affect one’s sex life, he and his girlfriend have had ‘the opposite’ experience.

‘Yeah, I feel like we've definitely proven that rumour to be wrong,’ Jenner joked.

The Keeping Up With The Kardashians star – who gave birth to her daughter Stormi Webster in February 2017 – continued, explaining that she often goes to her boyfriend for creative advice.

‘You have such a creative, out-of-the-box mind, so I love to come to you to get some advice on how to promote things, because you always have the craziest, coolest ideas,’ she said.

The entrepreneur added that she and Scott have ‘the same goals and passions in life’, which is why their relationship works so well.

Photo credit: Jon Kopaloff - Getty Images More

‘Besides the fact that we have good chemistry, we have a lot of fun together,’ she added. ‘You're my best friend. Through all the ups and downs that every relationship has, we evolve together through them and keep getting stronger.’

Jenner – who launched her eponymously-named beauty company Kylie Cosmetics in 2015 – also spoke about how proud she is of being, what Forbes described her as in March, the 'youngest self-made billionaire ever'.

‘I am really proud of myself for the things I've accomplished and worked hard for,’ Jenner explained. ‘I feel like the cover of Forbes was a huge moment when I exceeded expectations. That was a huge moment for me that was great recognition for everything I've done.’
